title: Best Routes from Tokyo to Miyazaki
theme: Asking how to get from Tokyo to Miyazaki prefecture

messages.content: Hello! I need to travel from Tokyo to Miyazaki next month for a friend's wedding. Could you help me understand the best way to get there? I've never been to Kyushu before.

Hello Mikiko-san! There are several ways to reach Miyazaki from Tokyo. The most common options are flying directly to Miyazaki Airport, taking the Shinkansen to Fukuoka and then a local train, or using overnight buses. When's the wedding, and how flexible are you with travel time?

The wedding is on a Saturday afternoon, and I'd like to arrive the day before to be safe. I prefer not to take overnight buses if possible. How long does each option take, and what are the typical costs?

A direct flight from Haneda to Miyazaki takes about 1 hour 45 minutes and costs around 짜25,000-35,000 round trip. The Shinkansen route (taking Nozomi to Hakata, then limited express to Miyazaki) takes about 8 hours total and costs approximately 짜40,000 one way, but it's covered by the JR Pass if you have one. Would you like me to check specific flight schedules for your dates?
Yes please! The flight sounds more convenient. Are there usually morning flights available? Also, what's the best way to get from Miyazaki Airport to the city center?

JAL and ANA both operate morning flights from Haneda, usually departing around 7:30 and 9:30. From Miyazaki Airport, you can take either the airport limousine bus (짜870, 40 minutes to the city) or a taxi (about 짜6,000, 25 minutes). The bus runs every 30-40 minutes. Would you like me to check flight availability and prices for your specific dates?
The 9:30 flight would be perfect! Yes, please check the availability. Do you know if there are any hotels near the wedding venue you'd recommend? It's at the Miyazaki Shrine.

Miyazaki Shrine is in a convenient location! The ANA Holiday Inn Miyazaki and JR Kyushu Hotel Miyazaki are both within 10 minutes' walk. There's also the traditional Miyazaki Kanko Hotel with great views of the city, about 15 minutes away by taxi. All have good access to the airport bus stops. Would you like me to check room availability?
The Miyazaki Kanko Hotel sounds nice! Yes, please check availability. Also, what's the weather usually like in Miyazaki? Should I pack anything specific?

Miyazaki is generally warmer than Tokyo - it has a subtropical climate. Which month is the wedding? Spring (March-May) is mild and pleasant, summer is hot and humid, autumn stays warm, and winter is quite mild. The city is known for its good weather, but it can get rain during the June-July rainy season.
It's in April! That sounds perfect for weather. Will I have time to do any sightseeing? I heard Miyazaki has some beautiful coastal areas.

April is lovely - cherry blossoms and comfortable temperatures! If you're arriving the day before, you could visit Aoshima Island and its botanical garden, just 30 minutes from the city. The famous Nichinan Coast drive is beautiful too. Would you like me to suggest a half-day sightseeing plan that won't interfere with the wedding schedule?
Yes, that would be wonderful! And one more thing - are there any famous local specialties I should try while I'm there?

Miyazaki is famous for Chicken Nanban (sweet and sour fried chicken), mangoes, and Miyazaki beef. Near the hotel, I recommend 'Ogura' for Chicken Nanban and 'Yakiniku Miyoshi' for local beef. There's also a famous sweet potato shochu called Kirishima. Would you like restaurant recommendations for your free time?
Yes please! Everything sounds delicious. Could you help me make dinner reservations for Friday night? And should I book the airport bus in advance?

I'll check dinner reservations for Friday. The airport bus doesn't need advance booking - you can buy tickets at the counter. Let me confirm your flight and hotel first, then I'll make the restaurant reservation. Would you also like me to arrange a taxi from the hotel to the shrine on the wedding day?
